intro: Nototriche pseudolobulata, commonly known as the false lobed nototriche, is a species of flowering plant in the family Scrophulariaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in a fine layer of silky hairs. Nototriche pseudolobulata is typically found in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
